dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5334 IH: Supporting Early-childhood Educators’ Deductions Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Panetta (for himself, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Ms. Goodlander, Mr. Valadao, Mr. Davis of Illinois, Mr. Mullin, Ms. Pingree, Mr. Carter of Louisiana, Ms. Craig, Mr. Pappas, and Mr. Neguse) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow early childhood educators to take the educator expense deduction, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting Early-childhood Educators’ Deductions Act of 2025 or the SEED Act of 2025.

section.header: Educator expense deduction to include early childhood educators

subsection.text: Section 62 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(2)(D), by striking the heading and inserting Certain expenses of early childhood, elementary, and secondary school teachers.;
in subsection (d)(1)(A), by striking kindergarten through grade 12 teacher and inserting, early childhood educator, kindergarten through grade 12 teacher; and

in subsection (d)(1)(B), by striking elementary education or secondary education (kindergarten through grade 12) and inserting, early childhood education, elementary education, or secondary education (pre-kindergarten through grade 12).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to expenses incurred in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
